commitResults.messageTitle: [#435] TestUtil: fix issue with whitespace in paths (#1556)
commitResults.messageBody:
The test suite will convert spaces in URLs into %20, which can lead to
test case failures. Java API recommends managing encoding and decoding
of URLs by using URI, which would resolve the issue with spaces.

This could save new developers some trouble when encountering test
failures while attempting to build the project locally for the first
time.

Let's fix the issues caused by whitespace in the test cases.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix missing space and use of raw types (#1569)
commitResults.messageBody:
There are multiple occurrences of use of raw type within the code
which results in compilation warnings. Additionally, there is a 
missing space in one of the error messages.

Let's address these minor issues in the code.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1575] Fix misidentification of deleted files as edited files (#1574)
commitResults.messageBody:
Current regex expression matches dev/null/ while the variable is
/dev/null/. This causes files to be wrongly treated as being edited
instead of being deleted.

Let's fix the misidentification of deleted files.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1546] RepoCloner: fix local repos relative pathing and spaces (#1562)
commitResults.messageBody:
At present, local repositories specified by relative pathing or paths
with spaces are not cloned properly even though their location is
verified.

Relative pathing issue is caused by processes being spawned at a
different root path. Issue relating to paths with spaces are caused by
RepoLocation objects converted back into strings to be used in a git
command, thus no longer wrapped in quotation marks. 

Let's fix these issues with local repos pathing.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1571] Fix incorrect invalidation of file path with spaces (#1576)
commitResults.messageBody:
The "git diff" command on files where the filename contains a space
causes the resulting output to generate an additional \t character at
the end of the filename. This becomes an invalid file path in Windows
while being incorrectly ignored in Macs and Linux.

Let's fix the incorrect identification of valid file paths with
spaces.

commitResults.messageTitle: Test: remove redundant throws Exception clauses (#1567)
commitResults.messageBody:
The current test code for RepoSense contains two methods that include
a redundant throws clause.

Let's remove both redundant throws clauses in GitCloneTest.java and
TimeUtilTest.java.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#937] Make all tests throw generic Exception (#1566)
commitResults.messageBody:
The current test code for RepoSense contains throws clauses that do
not throw a generic Exception. This can result in a series of code
changes that have to be made when the exception(s) thrown by an
existing method used in the test code is changed, to prevent a
compiler error.

Let's make all methods in the test (and systemtest) folder(s) of
RepoSense throw a generic Exception.

commitResults.messageTitle: Cypress: replace nonexistent input element with pug id in selector in codeView_reload.js (#1580)
commitResults.messageBody:
Cypress test in codeView.js is failing because the test analyzes
RepoSense's repository itself to run tests on. When PR#1412
was merged in, RepoSense no longer has any pug files whereas
the test case assumes pug files are still there thus leading to an
error. 

The selector utilized in the test refers to an input element with id 
`pug` that no longer exists.

Let's change the selector in the test to refer to an input element
with id `java` that still exists in RepoSense's repository.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1463] Fix case insensitive bug in @@author feature (#1577)
commitResults.messageBody:
Fix case insensitive bug of Map object used in @@author feature 
implementation

In AuthorConfiguration.java, the authorDetailsToAuthorMap object
utilized in AnnotatorAnalyzer.java for implementing the @@author
feature marks githubIds and gitIds with the same character sequence
but different casing as duplicates resulting in unnecessary warnings
in the log. When duplicates are encountered previous mappings might
also be altered resulting in potential unexpected assignings when
using the @@author feature.

Let's change the type of Map associated with the
authorDetailsToAuthorMap object from a TreeMap with
String.CASE_INSENSITIVE_ORDER as its Comparator to a HashMap.

commitResults.messageTitle: ConfigParser: fix Ignore Commits List header typo in CSV files (#1561)
commitResults.messageBody:
In RepoConfigCsvParser.java, the processLine method is unable to read
from Ignore Commit List column in config/repo-config.csv due to a
typo. Typo is also present in repoconfig_invalidLocation_test.csv
and ug/repo-config.csv.

Let's remove an extra 's' present in the Ignore Commit List header,
previously Ignore Commits List, in the three aforementioned files.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1547] Style: change if statements to use ternary operator (#1578)
commitResults.messageBody:
Some of the if statements can be simplified to use the ternary
operator for better readability. This also makes the code look
cleaner.

Let's change these if statements into the ternary operator.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1536] Frontend: show short commit hash in commits view (#1581)
commitResults.messageBody:
As commit subject lines can be identical, this may cause confusion to
the user when browsing the list of commits. Having 4 characters of 
the commit hash may be insufficient for differentiating between
commits.

Let's display the first 7 characters of the commit hash in the commits
view.

commitResults.messageTitle: Docs: update links in developer guide to frontend source files (#1583)
commitResults.messageBody:
After the transition to Vue, there are links and diagrams in the
Developer Guide documentation pages that still refer to files that
previously had .js extension and/or were located in now-deleted
folders.

Let's update these links and diagrams to reflect the new file
extensions and the updated location of these files.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tests: add unchecking and checking breakdown by file type test (#1587)
commitResults.messageBody:
When implementing the fix for the breakdown by file type checkbox,
there were no frontend tests added to ensure that the functionality
works. This left a gap in the frontend test suite and is not ideal.

Let's introduce a new frontend test for unchecking and checking the
breakdown by file type checkbox to ensure that the feature works as
intended.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1212] RepoLocation: Remove redundant backslashes in regex (#1550)
commitResults.messageBody:
In RepoLocation.java, our current regex is 
"^https?:\\/\\/github.com\\/(?<org>.+?)\\/(?<repoName>.+?)\\.git$".

There is no need to escape the forward slash "/" character with the
"\\" characters, as the forward slash does not have a special meaning
when used on its own.

Let's remove the redundant backslashes and add more tests for
different types of repository URLs.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#382, #1568] Make annotation tagged author appear in report (#1554)
commitResults.messageBody:
The current implementation will mark tagged authors as unknown if
their names do not appear in the commit history of the repo or in the
author config file.

Let's show all author introduced via the @@author tags if there is no
author config file. If there is an author config file, @@author tags
should not result in the author appearing in the report unless the
author is listed in the author config file.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#954] RepoConfiguration: remove redundant usage of streams (#1558)
commitResults.messageBody:
In the setStandaloneConfigIgnoredToRepoConfigs method of
RepoConfiguration, we iterate through a list of RepoConfiguration
objects and modify the isStandaloneConfigIgnored attribute in each
object. Currently, we use Stream.forEach(), which can be replaced by a
list.forEach() method since we already have a list.

Let's replace the redundant Stream.forEach() with the .forEach()
method.
